gross.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a gross sum of money is the total amount before any tax or costs have been taken away
gross.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a family with gross earnings of just £75 per week
gross.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a gross weight is the total weight of something, including its wrapping
gross.translation[0].definitions[2].note: gross indecency (=the crime of doing something that is sexually offensive)
gross.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: soldiers accused of gross violations of human rights
The company described reports of environmental disaster as gross exaggeration.
gross.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: very unpleasant to look at or think about
gross.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to gain an amount as a total profit, or earn it as a total amount, before tax has been taken away
gross.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The movie has already grossed over $10 million.
gross.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: a gross amount of money is the total amount before any costs or taxes have been taken away
gross.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: Mortgage payments often account for up to 30% of people’s gross earnings.
Last year, their travel and tourism business generated upwards of $400 million in gross revenues.
gross.translation[4].definitions[1].defi: a gross weight is the total weight of something, including the container or wrapping and the contents
gross.translation[4].definitions[1].exam: Coaches with a gross weight of less than 3.5 tons must be fitted with seat belts that comply with EU regulations.
gross.translation[4].definitions[2].defi: gross behaviour is seriously wrong and unacceptable
gross.translation[4].definitions[2].exam: The inquiry uncovered gross mismanagement at the Department.
gross.translation[5].definitions[0].defi: the amount paid by people to go and see a film in a particular period of time
gross.translation[5].definitions[0].exam: During its first weekend, the film had a box office gross of $95 million.
gross.translation[5].definitions[1].defi: the amount earned by a person or a business before costs and taxes are taken away
gross.translation[5].definitions[1].exam: While album sales once accounted for only a tiny share of his revenue, they now account for the majority of his annual gross of about $100,000.
gross.translation[5].definitions[2].exam: a cardboard box containing two gross of packets of Maltesers
gross.translation[6].definitions[0].defi: if a film grosses a particular amount, people pay that total amount of money to see it
gross.translation[6].definitions[0].exam: The film grossed $18.5 million in its opening weekend.
gross.translation[6].definitions[1].defi: if a person or business grosses a particular amount, they earn that total amount of money before costs and tax have been taken away
gross.translation[6].definitions[1].exam: He has never grossed over $50,000 dollars a year.
gross.translation[7].definitions[0].defi: if a person, business, or investment earns a particular amount gross, they earn that amount before tax has been taken away
gross.translation[7].definitions[0].exam: Leading shares now earn just 6% gross and pay dividends of 4% after tax.
